summary: This bill, S. 2483, addresses the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP). It stipulates that members of the ACIP can only be terminated "for cause," defined as inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance, with justification provided to Congress and the public. It also mandates the immediate reinstatement of ACIP members as they were on June 8, 2025, allowing them to complete their original terms. Furthermore, it requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to appoint new members to fill vacancies from a list recommended by the Comptroller General.
